[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Block Clone Safety] Does b.block().clone() at line 76 preserve all cryptographic signatures and commitments, or can cloning strip security metadata enabling block forgery? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization] Does new() at line 47-49 validate that execution_proxy is non-null and properly initialized, or can uninitialized/mock StateComputer be injected? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Batch Atomicity] Does the execution of ordered_blocks vector constitute an atomic batch, or if one block fails, are previous successful executions kept, leading to partial state updates? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [State Dependency] When executing blocks sequentially at line 73-84, does each block's execution depend on the previous block's state being committed first, or can parallel execution cause state inconsistency? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Inter-Block Verification] Is there validation that consecutive blocks in ordered_blocks form a valid chain (parent_id relationships), or can non-contiguous blocks be batched together? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Epoch Boundary] If ordered_blocks spans an epoch boundary (reconfiguration), does execution handle validator set changes correctly, or can this cause consensus split? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Struct: ExecutionResponse] [Response Integrity] ExecutionResponse contains block_id and inner result (lines 37-40) - can an attacker forge ExecutionResponse to claim successful execution without actually executing blocks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Block ID Mismatch] The block_id in ExecutionResponse (line 79-80, 87-88) is set before knowing all blocks succeed - can mismatched block_id cause buffer_manager to commit wrong blocks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/pipeline/execution_phase.rs] [Function: process()] [Success Response] At line 87-90, ExecutionResponse with Ok(result) is returned - does the buffer_manager verify that the result vector length matches ordered_blocks length to prevent silent block drops? (High)
